|flash1type = <!-- Parallel,Serial(SPI),NAND,Compact Flash --> |fla1_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla1chip = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |flash1size = <!-- Size of flash --> |flash1maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes -->
|ram1type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4 --> |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM --> |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = <!-- Size of RAM --> |ram1chip = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |ram1_num = <!-- Number of Ram chips --> |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->
|eth1chip = Supereal;SR3211UB; |lan_ports = 1 |lan_speed = 10MbE |ethstandard = <!-- auto --> |auto_mdix = <!-- mdix support --> |sup_jumbo = <!-- Jumbo frames support --> |ethoui = 00:E0:4C |oui = 00:E0:4C

|availability = <!-- Market availability --> |eoldate = <!-- End of Life date --> |fccapprovdate = <!-- FCCID approval date --> |estreldate = <!-- Estimated release date --> |estprice = <!-- Estimated retail price in US dollars --> |upc = <!-- UPC number --> |ean = <!-- EAN number --> |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = <!-- newegg item number --> |asin = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country = <!-- ASIN country --> |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |countrymanuf = <!-- Country device was manufactured in -->
|buttons = <!-- buttons available --> |led = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |dimensions = <!-- Size of device {{convert |length|x|widthordepth|x|height|in|mm}} --> |weight = <!-- Weight of device {{convert|weight|oz|g}} -->
|wi1_if_name = |rad1mod = B-LINK AP03 Wireless Module |rad1modif = USB (non-standard connector) |rad1chip1 = Ralink;RT2070; |rad1oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad1_ant_conn = <!-- Leave blank for unknown --> |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 |rad1correv = <!-- core revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |rad1cap = <!-- radio capabilities, Leave blank for none or unknown -->
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== The only significant chip on board is the Supereal SR3211UB (101301AF).
The manufacturer of this device appears to be '''B-LINK'''.
The unit is near identical to [http://www.oimai.net/article-641.html this pocket AP] (Syba I/O Crest SY-ADA24007, [http://www.dealextreme.com/p/portable-usb2-0-2-4ghz-54mbps-802-11b-g-wireless-wlan-router-ap-48684 on DX]) minus the RT2571W based module.
The device has two modes - AP mode and USB passthrough mode (where it acts as a plain old RT2070 based [ID 148f:2070] USB adapter).
[http://www.dealextreme.com/p/2-4ghz-54mbps-802-11g-b-wlan-wifi-wireless-usb-card-router-ap-45460 On DealExtreme?]
===Configuration=== 111111111111 (13 1s) is the default WEP and HTTP administration key. The HTTP administration (single) page is accessible from the wireless side only with the WEP/admin key required to change unit settings.
The ability to change settings is extremely limited... *the SSID will always have the KY669A prefix *the channel can be set to 3, 6, 9, or 11 only *the WEP/admin key can be changed *the device IP can be changed
==Pictures== <center>'''User Images''' <gallery caption="External"> File:China AP03 top.jpg|top of the unit File:China AP03 back.jpg|back of the unit File:China_AP03_angled_usb_switch.jpg|USB port and switch File:China AP03 angled ethernet reset.jpg|Ethernet port and reset button </gallery> <gallery caption="Internal"> File:China AP03 board top.jpg|board top File:China AP03 board bot.jpg|board bottom </gallery></center>[[Has images::internal| ]][[Has images::external| ]]
